import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
import lightgbm as lgb
import xgboost as xgb

# 1. Load data
train_path = 'data/train.csv'
valid_path = 'data/validation.csv'
test_path = 'data/test.csv'

df_train = pd.read_csv(train_path)
df_valid = pd.read_csv(valid_path)
df_test = pd.read_csv(test_path)

# Identify if validation has target; keep a copy
valid_has_target = 'SalePrice' in df_valid.columns
if valid_has_target:
    df_valid_features = df_valid.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
else:
    df_valid_features = df_valid.copy()

# Combine for consistent preprocessing
df_train_features = df_train.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
full_combined = pd.concat([df_train_features, df_valid_features, df_test], axis=0, ignore_index=True)

# Separate numeric and categorical columns
cat_cols = full_combined.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
num_cols = [c for c in full_combined.columns if c not in cat_cols]

# Fill missing values
full_combined[cat_cols] = full_combined[cat_cols].fillna('None')
for col in num_cols:
    full_combined[col] = full_combined[col].fillna(full_combined[col].median())

# One-hot encode categoricals
full_processed = pd.get_dummies(full_combined, columns=cat_cols, drop_first=False)

# Split back
n_train = df_train.shape[0]
n_valid = df_valid_features.shape[0]
train_X = full_processed.iloc[:n_train, :].values
valid_X = full_processed.iloc[n_train:n_train + n_valid, :].values
test_X = full_processed.iloc[n_train + n_valid:, :].values

# Target transformation
y = np.log1p(df_train['SalePrice']).values

# 2. Model definitions

    n_estimators=6000,
    learning_rate=0.01,
    num_leaves=31,
    subsample=0.8,

)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import lightgbm as lgb

# 1. Paths
train_path = 'data/train.csv'
valid_path = 'data/validation.csv'

# 2. Load data
df_train = pd.read_csv(train_path)
df_valid = pd.read_csv(valid_path)

# 3. Target
y = np.log1p(df_train['SalePrice'])
X = df_train.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
X_test = df_valid.copy()  # features for which we must predict

# 4. Identify column types
cat_cols = X.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
num_cols = [c for c in X.columns if c not in cat_cols]

# 5. Missing value handling
# Categorical -> 'None'
X[cat_cols] = X[cat_cols].fillna('None')
X_test[cat_cols] = X_test[cat_cols].fillna('None')
# Numeric -> median
for col in num_cols:
    median_val = X[col].median()
    X[col].fillna(median_val, inplace=True)
    X_test[col].fillna(median_val, inplace=True)

# 6. Convert categoricals to category dtype for LightGBM native handling
for col in cat_cols:
    X[col] = X[col].astype('category')
    X_test[col] = pd.Categorical(X_test[col], categories=X[col].cat.categories)

# 7. Internal split for early stopping
X_tr, X_val, y_tr, y_val = train_test_split(
    X, y, test_size=0.15, random_state=42)

# 8. LightGBM model
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    objective='regression',
    n_estimators=10000,
    learning_rate=0.01,
    num_leaves=31,
    subsample=0.8,
    colsample_bytree=0.8,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

model.fit(
    X_tr,
    y_tr,
    eval_set=[(X_val, y_val)],
    eval_metric='rmse',
    categorical_feature=list(cat_cols),
    early_stopping_rounds=200,
    verbose=False
)

# 9. Predict on validation set
valid_pred_log = model.predict(X_test, num_iteration=model.best_iteration_)
valid_pred = np.expm1(valid_pred_log)

# 10. Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': df_valid['Id'],
    'SalePrice': valid_pred
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import lightgbm as lgb
# 1. Paths
train_path = 'data/train.csv'
valid_path = 'data/validation.csv'
# 2. Load data
df_train = pd.read_csv(train_path)
df_valid = pd.read_csv(valid_path)
# 3. Target
y = np.log1p(df_train['SalePrice'])
X = df_train.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
X_test = df_valid.copy()  # features for which we must predict
# 4. Identify column types
cat_cols = X.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
num_cols = [c for c in X.columns if c not in cat_cols]
# 5. Missing value handling
# Categorical -> 'None'
X[cat_cols] = X[cat_cols].fillna('None')
X_test[cat_cols] = X_test[cat_cols].fillna('None')
# Numeric -> median
for col in num_cols:
    median_val = X[col].median()
    X[col].fillna(median_val, inplace=True)
    X_test[col].fillna(median_val, inplace=True)
# 6. Convert categoricals to category dtype for LightGBM native handling
for col in cat_cols:
    X[col] = X[col].astype('category')
    X_test[col] = pd.Categorical(X_test[col], categories=X[col].cat.categories)
# 7. Internal split for early stopping
X_tr, X_val, y_tr, y_val = train_test_split(
    X, y, test_size=0.15, random_state=42)
# 8. LightGBM model
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    objective='regression',
    n_estimators=10000,
    learning_rate=0.01,
    num_leaves=31,
    subsample=0.8,
    colsample_bytree=0.8,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)
model.fit(
    X_tr,
    y_tr,
    eval_set=[(X_val, y_val)],
    eval_metric='rmse',
    categorical_feature=list(cat_cols),
    early_stopping_rounds=200,
    verbose=False
)
# 9. Predict on validation set
valid_pred_log = model.predict(X_test, num_iteration=model.best_iteration_)
valid_pred = np.expm1(valid_pred_log)
# 10. Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': df_valid['Id'],
    'SalePrice': valid_pred
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Paths
TRAIN_PATH = 'data/train.csv'
VALID_PATH = 'data/validation.csv'

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv(TRAIN_PATH)
valid_df = pd.read_csv(VALID_PATH)

# Separate target
y = np.log1p(train_df['SalePrice'])
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
X_valid = valid_df.copy()

# Combine for consistent preprocessing
combined = pd.concat([X_train, X_valid], axis=0, ignore_index=True)

# Detect column types
cat_cols = combined.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
num_cols = [c for c in combined.columns if c not in cat_cols]

# Fill missing values
combined[cat_cols] = combined[cat_cols].fillna('Missing')
for col in num_cols:
    combined[col] = combined[col].fillna(combined[col].median())

# One-hot encode categoricals
combined = pd.get_dummies(combined, columns=cat_cols, drop_first=False)

# Split back
X_train_proc = combined.iloc[:len(X_train), :]
X_valid_proc = combined.iloc[len(X_train):, :]

# LightGBM regressor
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    objective='regression',
    n_estimators=2000,
    learning_rate=0.03,
    num_leaves=31,
    subsample=0.8,
    colsample_bytree=0.8,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

model.fit(X_train_proc, y)

# Predict and inverse-transform
valid_pred_log = model.predict(X_valid_proc)
valid_pred = np.expm1(valid_pred_log)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': valid_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': valid_pred
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
